review: I was given a 3 day dose of 500mg. No side effects until the 3rd day when my heart rate went up to 146bpm. I’m on a couple BP meds and got pretty freaked out. I contacted the cardiologist in call who basically said it’s doesn’t cause heart issues. This is incorrect according to everything I have read. I took my beta blocker and my heart rate came down. I’m thankful that I’m done with this medication. I’m not sure how effective it was since I’m also on a Medrol dose  pak. I’ll be real happy when both of these meds are out of my system.  Azithromycin has a 68 hr half life.

I was prescribed Lupin Azithromycin (Z pack) on 1/13/21.  You take it for five days and its effects last 6-10 days. I read that the half-life of the drug after you take the last dose is another 15.5 days, so it stays in your system a while.  By day 7,  I had serious fatigue and confusion. I also started having palpitations, brain fog, dizziness and anxiety .  All I can do now is wait until this tainted drug gets out of my system and hope it hasn't caused permanent damage.  My optician wrote the prescription for a stye on my eye.  I wish I hadn't compromised my otherwise excellent health for something so minor by by taking this awful drug.

Zithromax (azithromycin):I took 1 pill and about 6 hours later, I was getting out of my car and woke up on the sidewalk. I had passed out with no warning signs or symptoms. I passed out again within 2 minutes of the first time. I went to the local Urgent Care and after speaking to the doctor, he believes it was a side effect of the zpak. That is the only change in any food, drink or medication for weeks. I was not overheated and I was hydrated prior to passing out.

I have taken a zpack for years now when I have infections due to having severe allergies to other medication families. I am faced with yet another soft tissue tooth infection and will of course be asking for my usual zpack to make it go down until we can get heart clearance from my doctors to have the teeth that are infected removed.
